text: Make q the subject of the formula in the equation \(\frac{mn}{a^2} - \frac{pq}{b^2} = 1\)
explanation:
\(\frac{mn}{a^2} - \frac{pq}{b^2} = 1\)
\(\frac{mn}{a^2} - 1 = \frac{pq}{b^2}\)
\(\frac{mn - a^2}{a^2} = \frac{pq}{b^2}\)
\(pq = \frac{b^2 (mn - a^2)}{a^2}\)
\(q = \frac{b^2(mn - a^2)}{a^2 p}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The angle of elevation of the top of a tree from a point on the ground 60m away from the foot of the tree is 78°. Find the height of the tree correct to the nearest whole number.
explanation:
\(\tan 78 = \frac{h}{60}\)
\(h = 60 \tan 78\)
\(h = 60 \times 4.705 = 282.27m\)
\(\approxeq\) 282m to the nearest whole number.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A binary operation \(\otimes\) is defined by \(m \otimes n = mn + m - n\) on the set of real numbers, for all m, n \(\in\) R. Find the value of 3 \(\otimes\) (2 \(\otimes\) 4).
explanation:
\(m \otimes n = mn + m - n\)
3 \(\otimes\) (2 \(\otimes\) 4)
2 \(\otimes\) 4 = 2(4) + 2 - 4 = 6
3 \(otimes\) 6 = 3(6) + 3 - 6  = 15
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Age in years
7
8
9
10
11


No of pupils
4
13
30
44
9



The table above shows the number of pupils in a class with respect to their ages. If a pie chart is constructed to represent the age, the angle corresponding to 8 years old is
explanation:
Total number of pupils : 4 + 13 + 30 + 44 + 9 = 100
The number of 8 - year olds = 13
The angle represented by the 8-year olds on the pie chart = \(\frac{13}{100} \times 360°\)
= 46.8°
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In a class of 50 students, 40 students offered Physics and 30 offered Biology. How many offered both Physics and Biology?
explanation:
n(Total) = 50
n(Physics) = 40
n(Biology) = 30
Let n(Physics and Biology) = x
n(Physics only) = 40 -x
n(Biology only) = 30 - x
40 - x + 30 - x + x = 50
70 - x = 50
x = 20
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Rationalize \(\frac{\sqrt{2} + \sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{2} - \sqrt{3}}\)
explanation:
\(\frac{\sqrt{2} + \sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{2} - \sqrt{3}}\)
= \((\frac{\sqrt{2} + \sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{2} - \sqrt{3}})(\frac{\sqrt{2} + \sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{2} + \sqrt{3}})\)
= \(\frac{2 + \sqrt{6} + \sqrt{6} + 3}{2 - \sqrt{6} + \sqrt{6} - 3}\)
= \(\frac{5 + 2\sqrt{6}}{-1}\)
= \(- 5 - 2\sqrt{6}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the length of the chord |AB| in the diagram shown above.
explanation:
Length of chord = \(2r \sin (\frac{\theta}{2})\)
= \(2(3) \sin (\frac{68}{2})\)
= \(6 \sin 34\)
= \(6 \times 0.559\)
= 3.354 cm \(\approxeq\)  3.4 cm
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Given \(\sin 58° = \cos p°\), find p.
explanation:
\(\sin \theta = \cos (90 - \theta)\)
\(\sin \theta = \cos (90 - 58)\)
= \(\cos 32\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

\(\frac{\frac{2}{3} \div \frac{4}{5}}{\frac{1}{4} + \frac{3}{5} - \frac{1}{3}}\)
\(\frac{2}{3} \div \frac{4}{5} = \frac{2}{3} \times \frac{5}{4}\)
= \(\frac{5}{6}\)
\(\frac{1}{4} + \frac{3}{5} - \frac{1}{3} = \frac{15 + 36 - 20}{60}\)
= \(\frac{31}{60}\)
\(\therefore \frac{\frac{2}{3} \div \frac{4}{5}}{\frac{1}{4} + \frac{3}{5} - \frac{1}{3}} = \frac{5}{6} \div \frac{31}{60}\)
= \(\frac{5}{6} \times \frac{60}{31}\)
= \(\frac{50}{31}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If \(6x^3 + 2x^2 - 5x + 1\) divides \(x^2 - x - 1\), find the remainder.
explanation: There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If a fair coin is tossed 3 times, what is the probability of getting at least two heads?
explanation:
The outcomes are {HHH, HHT, HTT, HTH, THH, THT, TTH, TTT}
P(at least two heads) = \(\frac{4}{8}\)
= \(\frac{1}{2}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In how many ways can the word MATHEMATICIAN be arranged?
explanation:
MATHEMATICIAN = 13 letters with 2M, 3A, 2T, 2I.
Hence, the word MATHEMATICIAN can be arranged in \(\frac{13!}{2! 3! 2! 2!}\)
= 129729600 ways
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Given matrix M = \(\begin{vmatrix} -2 & 0 & 4 \\ 0 & -1 & 6 \\ 5 & 6 & 3 \end{vmatrix}\), find \(M^{T} + 2M\)
explanation:
M = \(\begin{vmatrix} -2 & 0 & 4 \\ 0 & -1 & 6 \\ 5 & 6 & 3 \end{vmatrix}\)
M\(^{T}\) = \(\begin{vmatrix} -2 & 0 & 5 \\ 0 & -1 & 6\\ 4 & 6 & 3 \end{vmatrix}\)
2M = \(\begin{vmatrix} -4 & 0 & 8\\ 0 & -2 & 12\\ 10 & 12 & 6\end{vmatrix}\)
M\(^T\) + 2M = \(\begin{vmatrix} -6 & 0 & 13 \\ 0 & -3 & 18 \\ 14 & 18 & 9 \end{vmatrix}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

explanation:

Find the variance
The locus of a point which moves so that it is equidistant from two intersecting straight lines is the

options.B: line parallel to the two lines
options.C: angle bisector of the two lines
options.D: perpendicular bisector of the two lines

explanation:
The locus of a points equidistant from two intersecting straight lines is a pair of bisectors that bisect the angles formed by the two intersecting lines.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: From the cyclic quadrilateral MNOP above, find the value of x.
explanation:
The sum of two opposite angles of a cyclic quadrilateral = 180°
\(\therefore\) (2x + 18)° + 84° = 180°
2x + 102° = 180° \(\implies\) 2x = 78°
x = 39°
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If \(4\sin^2 x - 3 = 0\), find the value of x, when 0° \(\leq\) x \(\leq\) 90°
explanation:
\(4\sin^2 x - 3 = 0\)
\(4 \sin^2 x = 3 \implies \sin^2 x = \frac{3}{4}\)
\(\sin x = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}\)
\(\therefore x = \sin^{-1} (\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2})\)
x = 60°
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In the figure above, |CD| is the base of the triangle CDE. Find the area of the figure to the nearest whole number.
explanation:
Area of rectangle ABCD = length x breadth
= 7 x 4
= 28 cm\(^2\)
Area of triangle CDE = \(\frac{1}{2}\) base x height
= \(\frac{1}{2} \times 3 \times 4\)
= 6 cm\(^2\)
Area of the figure = 28 cm\(^2\) + 6 cm\(^2\)
= 34 cm\(^2\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

The marks scored by 30 students in a Mathematics test are recorded in the table below:



Scores (Mark)

No of students

What is the total number of marks scored by the children?
explanation:
Scores (Mark)012345No of students437862fx031424241075
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If given two points A(3, 12) and B(5, 22) on a x-y plane. Find the equation of the straight line with intercept at 2.
explanation:
The equation of a straight line is given as \(y = mx + b\)
where m = the slope of the line
b = intercept
Given points A(3, 12) and B(5, 22), the slope = \(\frac{22 - 12}{5 - 3}\)
= \(\frac{10}{2}\) = 5
Hence, the equation of the line is \(y = 5x + 2\).
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If P(2, m) is the midpoint of the line joining Q(m, n) and R(n, -4), find the values of m and n.
explanation:
Q(m, n) and R(n, -4)
Midpoint : P(2, m)
\(\implies (\frac{m + n}{2}, \frac{n - 4}{2}) = (2, m)\)
\(m + n = 2 \times 2 \implies m + n = 4 ... (i)\)
\(n - 4 = 2 \times m \implies n - 4 = 2m ... (ii)\)
Solving (i) and (ii) simultaneously,
m = 0 and n = 4.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If \(\begin{vmatrix} 2 & -4 \\ x & 9 \end{vmatrix} = 58\), find the value of x.
explanation:
\(\begin{vmatrix} 2 & -4 \\ x & 9 \end{vmatrix} = 58\)
\(\implies (2 \times 9) - (-4 \times x) = 58\)
\(18 + 4x = 58 \implies 4x = 58 - 18 = 40\)
\(x = 10\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If \(y = 6x^3 + 2x^{-2} - x^{-3}\), find \(\frac{\mathrm d y}{\mathrm d x}\).
explanation:
\(y = 6x^3 + 2x^{-2} - x^{-3}\)
\(\frac{\mathrm d y}{\mathrm d x} = 18x^2 - 4x^{-3} + 3x^{-4}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: \(\frac{d}{dx} [\log (4x^3 - 2x)]\) is equal to
explanation:
\(\frac{d}{dx} [\log (4x^3 - 2x)]\) ... (1)
Let u = 4x\(^3\) - 2x.
\(\frac{\mathrm d}{\mathrm d x} (\log (4x^3 - 2x)) = (\frac{\mathrm d}{\mathrm d u})(\frac{\mathrm d u}{\mathrm d x})\)
\(\frac{\mathrm d}{\mathrm d u} (\log u)\) = \(\frac{1}{u}\)
\(\frac{\mathrm d u}{\mathrm d x} = 12x^2 - 2\)
\(\therefore \frac{d}{dx} [\log (4x^3 - 2x)] = \frac{12x^2 - 2}{u}\)
= \(\frac{12x^2 - 2}{4x^3 - 2x}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If \(f(x) = 3x^3 + 4x^2 + x - 8\), what is the value of f(-2)?
Solve for x in \(\frac{4x - 6}{3} \leq \frac{3 + 2x}{2}\)
explanation:
\(\frac{4x - 6}{3} \leq \frac{3 + 2x}{2}\)
2(4x - 6) \(\leq\) 3(3 + 2x)
8x - 12 \(\leq\) 9 + 6x
8x - 6x \(\leq\) 9 + 12
2x \(\leq\) 21
\(x \leq \frac{21}{2}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Solve the inequality: -7 \(\leq\) 9 - 8x < 16 - x
explanation:
-7 \(\leq\) 9 - 8x < 16 - x
-7 \(\leq\) 9 - 8x and 9 - 8x < 16 - x
-7 - 9 \(\leq\) -8x and -8x + x < 16 - 9
-16 \(\leq\) -8x and -7x < 7
\(\therefore\) x \(\leq\) 2 and -1 < x
-1 < x \(\leq\) 2.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The nth term of a sequence is given by 2\(^{2n - 1}\). Find the sum of the first four terms.
Integrate \(\int_{-1} ^{2} (2x^2 + x) \mathrm {d} x\)
If P varies inversely as the square root of q, where p = 3 and q = 16, find the value of q when p = 4.
explanation:
\(p \propto \frac{1}{\sqrt{q}}\)
\(\implies p = \frac{k}{\sqrt{q}}\)
when p = 3, q = 16.
\(3 = \frac{k}{\sqrt{16}}\)
\(k = 3 \times 4 = 12\)
\(\therefore p = \frac{12}{\sqrt{q}}\)
when p = 4,
\(4 = \frac{12}{\sqrt{q}} \implies \sqrt{q} = \frac{12}{4}\)
\(\sqrt{q} = 3 \implies q = 3^2 \)
\(q = 9\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Tade bought 200 mangoes at 4 for ₦2.50. 30 out of the mangoes got spoilt and the remaining were sold at 2 for ₦2.40. Find the percentage profit or loss.
explanation:
200 mangoes at 4 for N2.50
\(\implies\) Total cost price = \(\frac{200}{4} \times N 2.50\)
= N 125.00
Since 30 mangoes got spoilt \(\implies\) Left over = 200 - 30
= 170 mangoes
170 mangoes at 2 for N 2.40
\(\implies\) Total selling point = \(\frac{170}{2} \times N 2.40\)
= N 204.00
Profit : N (204.00 - 125.00) = N 79.00
% profit = \(\frac{79}{125} \times 100%\)
= 63.2% profit.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The simple interest on ₦8550 for 3 years at x% per annum is ₦4890. Calculate the value of x to the nearest whole number.
explanation:
S.I = \(\frac{PRT}{100}\)
\(\implies\) N 4890 = \(\frac{8550 \times 3 \times x}{100}\)
\(x = \frac{4890 \times 100}{8550 \times 3}\)
\(x = 19.06%\)
\(x \approxeq 19%\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

81\(^{\frac{-3}{4}}\) x 25\(^{\frac{1}{2}}\) x 243\(^{\frac{2}{5}}\)
= \((\sqrt[4]{81})^{-3} \times \sqrt{25} \times (\sqrt[5]{243})^2\)
= \(\frac{5 \times 3^2}{3^{3}}\)
= \(\frac{5}{3}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the value of \(\frac{(0.5436)^3}{0.017 \times 0.219}\) to 3 significant figures.
explanation:
(\frac{(0.5436)^3}{0.017 \times 0.219}\)
= \(\frac{0.16063}{0.017 \times 0.219}\)
= 43.1 (to 3 s.f)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If S = (4t + 3)(t - 2), find ds/dt when t = 5 secs.
explanation:
\(s = (4t + 3)(t - 2)\)
\(\frac{\mathrm d s}{\mathrm d t} = (4t + 3)(1) + (t - 2)(4)\)
= \(4t + 3 + 4t - 8\)
= 8t - 5
\(\frac{\mathrm d s}{\mathrm d t} (t = 5 secs) = 8(5) - 5\)
= 40 - 5
= 35 units per sec
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The angles of a polygon are given by 2x, 5x, x and 4x respectively. The value of x is
explanation:
Since there are 4 angles given, the polygon is a quadrilateral.
Sum of angle in a quadrilateral = 360°
\(\therefore\) 2x + 5x + x + 4x = 360°
12x = 360°
x = 30°
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The weight of a day-old chick was measured to be 0.21g. If the actual weight of the chick is 0.18g, what was the percentage error in the measurement?
explanation:
Actual weight = 0.18g
Error = 0.21g - 0.18g
= 0.03g
% error = \(\frac{0.03}{0.18} \times 100%\)
= 16.7%
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Evaluate \((\frac{6}{0.32} \div \frac{2}{0.084})^{-1}\) correct to 1 decimal place.
explanation:
\((\frac{6}{0.32} \div \frac{2}{0.084})^{-1}\)
= \((\frac{600}{32} \div \frac{2000}{84})^{-1}\)
= \((\frac{600}{32} \times \frac{84}{2000})^{-1}\)
= \((\frac{63}{80})^{-1}\)
= \(\frac{80}{63}\)
= 1.3 (to 1 decimal place)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If 2\(^{x + y}\) = 16 and 4\(^{x - y} = \frac{1}{32}\), find the values of x and y.
explanation:
2\(^{x + y}\) = 16 ; 4\(^{x - y}\) = \(\frac{1}{32}\).
\(\implies 2^{x + y} = 2^4\)
\(x + y = 4 ... (1)\)
\(2^{2(x - y)} = 2^{-5} \)
\(2^{2x - 2y} = 2^{-5}\)
\(\implies 2x - 2y = -5 ... (2)\)
Solving the equations (1) and (2) simultaneously, we have
x = \(\frac{3}{4}\) and y = \(\frac{13}{4}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Simplify \(\frac{0.0839 \times 6.381}{5.44}\) to 2 significant figures.
explanation:
click here
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the value of x and y in the simultaneous equation: 3x + y = 21; xy = 30
explanation:
3x + y = 21 ... (i);
xy = 30 ... (ii)
From (ii), \(y = \frac{30}{x}\). Putting the value of y in (i), we have
3x + \(\frac{30}{x}\) = 21
\(\implies\) 3x\(^2\) + 30 = 21x
3x\(^2\) - 21x + 30 = 0
3x\(^2\) - 15x - 6x + 30 = 0
3x(x - 5) - 6(x - 5) = 0
(3x - 6)(x - 5) = 0
3x - 6 = 0 \(\implies\) x = 2.
x - 5 = 0 \(\implies\) x = 5.
If x = 2, y = \(\frac{30}{2}\) = 15;
If x = 5, y = \(\frac{30}{5}\) = 6.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Points X and Y are 20km North and 9km East of point O, respectively. What is the bearing of Y from X? Correct to the nearest degree.
explanation:
\(\tan \theta = \frac{9}{20} = 0.45\)
\(\theta = \tan^{-1} (0.45) \)
= 24.23°
\(\therefore\) The bearing of Y from X = 180° - 24.23°
= 155.77°
= 156° (to the nearest degree)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If \(P = (\frac{Q(R - T)}{15})^{\frac{1}{3}}\), make T the subject of the formula.
explanation:
\(P = (\frac{Q(R - T)}{15})^{\frac{1}{3}}\)
\(P^3 = \frac{Q(R - T)}{15}\)
\(Q(R - T) = 15P^3\)
\(R - T = \frac{15P^3}{Q}\)
\(T = R - \frac{15P^3}{Q}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In the diagram above, O is the centre of the circle ABC, < ABO = 26° and < BOC = 130°. Calculate < AOC.
explanation:
< BAC = \(\frac{130}{2}\) (angle subtended at the centre)
< BAC = 65°
Also, x = 26° (theorem)
y = 65° - 26° = 39°
< AOC = 180° - (39° + 39°)
= 102°
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Each of the interior angles of a regular polygon is 140°. Calculate the sum of all the interior angles of the polygon.
explanation:
Since each interior angle = 140°;
Each exterior angle = 180° - 140° = 40°
Number of sides of the polygon = \(\frac{360°}{40°}\)
= 9
Sum of angles in the polygon = 140° x 9
= 1260°
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A man bought a car newly for ₦1,250,000. He had a crash with the car and later sold it at the rate of ₦1,085,000. What is the percentage gain or loss of the man?
explanation:
Cost price of the car = N 1,250.00
Selling price = N 1,085.00
Loss = N (1250 - 1085)
= N 165.00
% loss = \(\frac{165}{1250} \times 100%\)
= 13.2% loss
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If the volume of a frustrum is given as \(V = \frac{\pi h}{3} (R^2 + Rr + r^2)\), find \(\frac{\mathrm d V}{\mathrm d R}\).
explanation:
\(V = \frac{\pi h}{3} (R^2 + Rr + r^2)\)
\(V = \frac{\pi R^2 h}{3} + \frac{\pi Rr h}{3} + \frac{\pi r^2 h}{3}\)
\(\frac{\mathrm d V}{\mathrm d R} = \frac{2 \pi R h}{3} + \frac{\pi r h}{3}\)
= \(\frac{\pi}{3} (2R + r)\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Express \((0.0439 \div 3.62)\) as a fraction.
explanation:
\((0.0439 \div 3.62)\)
= 0.01213
\(\approxeq\) 0.012
= \(\frac{12}{1000}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If \(25^{1 - x} \times 5^{x + 2} \div (\frac{1}{125})^{x} = 625^{-1}\), find the value of x.

A bricklayer charges ₦1,500 per day for himself and ₦500 per day for his assistant. If a two bedroom flat was built for ₦95,000 and the bricklayer worked 10 days more than his assistant, how much did the assistant receive?
explanation:
Let the number of days worked by the assistant = t
\(\therefore\) The bricklayer worked (t + 10) days.
1500(t + 10) + 500(t) = N 95,000
1500t + 15,000 + 500t = N 95,000
2000t = N 95,000 - N 15,000
2000t = N 80,000
t = 40 days
\(\therefore\) The assistant worked for 40 days and received N (500 x 40)
= N 20,000
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the equation of the locus of a point A(x, y) which is equidistant from B(0, 2) and C(2, 1)
explanation:
Since A(x, y) is the point of equidistance between B and C, then
AB = AC
(AB)\(^2\) = (AC)\(^2\)
Using the distance formula,
(x - 0)\(^2\) + (y - 2)\(^2\) = (x - 2)\(^2\) + (y - 1)\(^2\)
x\(^2\) + y\(^2\) - 4y + 4 = x\(^2\) - 4x + 4 + y\(^2\) - 2y + 1
x\(^2\) - x\(^2\) + y\(^2\) - y\(^2\) + 4x - 4y + 2y = 5 - 4
4x - 2y = 1
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A factory worker earns ₦50,000 per month out of which he spends 15% on his children's education, ₦13,600 on Food, 3% on electricity and uses the rest for his personal purpose. How much does he have left?
explanation:
Education = \(\frac{15}{100} \times N 50,000\)
= N 7,500
Food = N 13,600
Electricity = \(\frac{3}{100} \times N 50,000\)
= N 1,500
Leftover : N (50,000 - (7,500 + 13,600 + 1,500))
= N 27,400
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
A binary operation Δ is defined by a Δ b = a + 3b + 2.
Find (3 Δ 2) Δ 5
explanation:
a Δ b = a + 3b + 2
(3 Δ 2) Δ 5 = (3 + 3(2) + 2) Δ 5
= 11 Δ 5
= 11 + 3(5) + 2
= 28
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If M varies directly as N and inversely as the root of P. Given that M = 3, N = 5 and P = 25. Find the value of P when M = 2 and N = 6.
explanation:
\(M \propto N \) ; \(M \propto \frac{1}{\sqrt{P}}\).
\(\therefore M \propto \frac{N}{\sqrt{P}}\)
\(M = \frac{k N}{\sqrt{P}}\)
when M = 3, N = 5 and P = 25;
\(3 = \frac{5k}{\sqrt{25}}\)
\(k = 3\)
\(M = \frac{3N}{\sqrt{P}}\)
when M = 2 and N = 6,
\(2 = \frac{3(6)}{\sqrt{P}} \implies \sqrt{P} = \frac{18}{2}\)
\(\sqrt{P} = 9 \implies P = 9^2\)
P = 81
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This table below gives the scores of a group of students in a Further Mathematics Test.



Score
1
2
3
4
5
6
7


Frequency
4
6
8
4
10
6
2



Find the mode of the distribution.
explanation:
Mode = Score with the highest frequency
= 5
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

Calculate the mean deviation for the distribution
Integrate \(\int (4x^{-3} - 7x^2 + 5x - 6) \mathrm d x\).
explanation:
\(\int (4x^{-3} - 7x^2 + 5x - 6) \mathrm d x\)
= \(\frac{4x^{-3 + 1}}{-3 + 1} - \frac{7x^{2 + 1}}{2 + 1} + \frac{5x^{1 + 1}}{1 + 1} - 6x\)
= \(-2x^{-2} - \frac{7}{3} x^3 + \frac{5}{2} x^2 - 6x\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the probability that a number selected at random from 21 to 34 is a multiple of 3
If the 3rd and 7th terms of a G.P are 9 and 1/9 respectively. Find the common ratio.
explanation:
\(T_n = ar^{n - 1}\) (terms of a G.P)
\(T_3 = ar^2 = 9\) ... (i)
\(T_7 = ar^6 = \frac{1}{9}\) ... (ii)
Divide (i) by (ii);
\(\frac{ar^6}{ar^2} = \frac{\frac{1}{9}}{9}\)
\(r^4 = \frac{1}{81}\)
\(r^4 = (\frac{1}{3})^4\)
\(r = \frac{1}{3}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In a committee of 5, which must be selected from 4 males and 3 females. In how many ways can the members be chosen if it were to include 2 females?
explanation:
For the committee to include 2 females, we must have 3 males, so that there should be 5 members.
That is, \(^4C_3 \times ^3C_2\)
= \(\frac{4!}{(4 - 3)! 3!} \times \frac{3!}{(3 - 2)! 2!}\)
= 4 × 3 = 12 ways
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the value of k in the equation: \(\sqrt{28} + \sqrt{112} - \sqrt{k} = \sqrt{175}\)
explanation:
\(\sqrt{28} + \sqrt{112} - \sqrt{k} = \sqrt{175}\)
\(\sqrt{4 \times 7} + \sqrt{16 \times 7} - \sqrt{k} = \sqrt{25 \times 7}\)
\(2\sqrt{7} + 4\sqrt{7} - \sqrt{k} = 5\sqrt{7}\)
\(6\sqrt{7} - 5\sqrt{7} = \sqrt{k}\)
\(\sqrt{k} = \sqrt{7}\)
\(\implies k = 7\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Evaluate \(\frac{2\log_{3} 9 \times \log_{3} 81^{-2}}{\log_{5} 625}\)
explanation:
\(\frac{2\log_{3} 9 \times \log_{3} 81^{-2}}{\log_{5} 625}\)
= \(\frac{2\log_3 3^2 \times \log_3 (3^4)^{-2}}{\log_5 (5^4)}\)
= \(\frac{4\log_3 3 \times -8\log_3 3}{4\log_5 5}\)
= -8.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the value of x for \(\frac{2 + 2x}{3} - 2 \geq \frac{4x - 6}{5}\)
explanation:
\(\frac{2 + 2x}{3} - 2 \geq \frac{4x - 6}{5}\)
\(\frac{2 + 2x - 6}{3} \geq \frac{4x - 6}{5}\)
\(\frac{2x - 4}{3} \geq \frac{4x - 6}{5}\)
\(5(2x - 4) \geq 3(4x - 6)\)
\(10x - 20 \geq 12x - 18\)
\(10x - 12x \geq -18 + 20\)
\(-2x \geq 2\)
\(x \leq -1\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Determine the values for which \(x^2 - 7x + 10 \leq 0\)
explanation:
\(x^2 - 7x + 10 \leq 0\)
Solve for \(x^2 - 7x + 10 = 0\)
We have, (x - 5)(x - 2) \(\leq\) 0.
Conditions:
Case 1: (x - 5) \(\leq\) 0, (x - 2) \(\geq\) 0.
\(\implies\) x \(\leq\) 5; x \(\geq\) 2.
2 \(\leq\) x \(\leq\) 5.
Choosing x = 3,
3\(^2\) - 7(3) + 10 = 9 - 21 + 10
= -2 \(\leq\) 0.
\(\therefore\) 2 \(\leq\) x \(\leq\) 5.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the polynomial if given q(x) = x\(^2\) - x - 5, d(x) = 3x - 1 and r(x) = 7.
explanation:
Given q(x) [quotient], d(x) [divisor] and r(x) [remainder], the polynomial is gotten by multiplying the quotient and the divisor and adding the remainder.
i.e In this case, the polynomial = (x\(^2\) - x - 5)(3x - 1) + 7.
= (3x\(^3\) - x\(^2\) - 3x\(^2\) + x - 15x + 5) + 7
= (3x\(^3\) - 4x\(^2\) - 14x + 5) + 7
= 3x\(^3\) - 4x\(^2\) - 14x + 12
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If 2x\(^2\) + x - 3 divides x - 2, find the remainder.
explanation:
When you divide a polynomial p(x) by (x - a), the remainder = p(a)
i.e. In the case of 2x\(^2\) + x - 3 \(\div\) (x - 2), the remainder = p(2).
= 2(2)\(^2\) + 2 - 3
= 8 + 2 - 3
= 7.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If \(\begin{vmatrix} 2 & -5 & 3 \\ x & 1 & 4 \\ 0 & 3 & 2 \end{vmatrix} = 132\), find the value of x.
explanation:
\(\begin{vmatrix} 2 & -5 & 3 \\ x & 1 & 4 \\ 0 & 3 & 2 \end{vmatrix} = 132\)
\(\implies 2 \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 4 \\ 3 & 2 \end{vmatrix} - (-5) \begin{vmatrix} x & 4 \\ 0 & 2 \end{vmatrix} + 3 \begin{vmatrix} x & 1 \\ 0 & 3 \end{vmatrix} = 132\)
\(2(2 - 12) + 5(2x) + 3(3x) = 132\)
\(-20 + 10x + 9x = 132\)
\(19x = 152\)
\(x = 8\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Given the matrix \(A = \begin{vmatrix} 3 & -2 \\ 1 & 6 \end{vmatrix}\). Find the inverse of matrix A.
explanation:
\(A = \begin{vmatrix} 3 & -2 \\ 1 & 6 \end{vmatrix}\)
|A| = (3 x 6) - (-2 x 1)
= 18 + 2
= 20.
A\(^{-1}\) = \(\frac{1}{20} \begin{vmatrix} 6 & 2 \\ -1 & 3 \end{vmatrix}\)
= \(\begin{vmatrix} \frac{6}{20} & \frac{2}{20} \\ \frac{-1}{20} & \frac{3}{20} \end{vmatrix}\)
= \(\begin{vmatrix} \frac{3}{10} & \frac{1}{10} \\ \frac{-1}{20} & \frac{3}{20} \end{vmatrix}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If y = 8x\(^3\) - 3x\(^2\) + 7x - 1, find \(\frac{\mathrm d^2 y}{\mathrm d x^2}\).
explanation:
y = 8x\(^3\) - 3x\(^2\) + 7x - 1
\(\frac{\mathrm d^2 y}{\mathrm d x^2}  = \frac{\mathrm d}{\mathrm d x} (\frac{\mathrm d y}{\mathrm d x})\)
= \(\frac{\mathrm d}{\mathrm d x} (24x^2 - 6x + 7)\)
\(\frac{\mathrm d^2 y}{\mathrm d x^2} = 48x - 6\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Differentiate \(\frac{2x}{\sin x}\) with respect to x.
explanation:
click here
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the distance between the points C(2, 2) and D(5, 6).
explanation:
= \(\sqrt{(5 - 2)^2 + (6 - 2)^2}\)
= \(\sqrt{3^2 + 4^2}\)
= \(\sqrt{9 + 16}\)
= \(\sqrt{25}\)
= 5 units
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the equation of a line perpendicular to the line 4y = 7x + 3 which passes through (-3, 1)
explanation:
Equation: 4y = 7x + 3
\(\implies y = \frac{7}{4} x + \frac{3}{4}\)
Slope = coefficient of x = \(\frac{7}{4}\)
Slope of perpendicular line = \(\frac{-1}{\frac{7}{4}}\)
= \(\frac{-4}{7}\)
The perpendicular line passes (-3, 1)
\(\therefore\) Using the equation of line \(y = mx + b\)
m = slope and b = intercept.
\(y = \frac{-4}{7} x + b\)
To find the intercept, substitute y = 1 and x = -3 in the equation.
\(1 = \frac{-4}{7} (-3) + b\)
\(1 = \frac{12}{7} + b\)
\(b = \frac{-5}{7}\)
\(\therefore y = \frac{-4}{7} x - \frac{5}{7}\)
\(7y + 4x + 5 = 0\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

The table above is the distribution of data with mean equals to 3. Find the value of y.
explanation:
Marks (x)12345Frequency (f)2y - 2y - 13y - 43 - y6 - 2y3y + 2fx2y - 22y - 29y - 1212 - 4y30 - 10y26 - y
Mean = \(\frac{\sum fx}{\sum f}\)
\(3 = \frac{26 - y}{3y + 2}\)
\(3(3y + 2) = 26 - y\)
\(9y + 6 = 26 - y\)
\(9y + y = 26 - 6\)
\(10y = 20 \implies y = 2\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The histogram above represents the number of candidates who did Further Mathematics examination in a school. How many candidates scored more than 40?
explanation:
Number of students that scored above 40 = 55 + 45 + 30 + 15 + 5
= 150 students.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In the circle above, with centre O and radius 7 cm. Find the length of the arc AB, when < AOB = 57°.
explanation:
Length of arc = \(\frac{\theta}{360°} \times 2 \pi r\)
= \(\frac{57}{360} \times 2 \times \frac{22}{7} \times 7\)
= 6.97 cm
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Calculate the volume of the regular three dimensional figure drawn above, where < ABC = 90° (a right- angled triangle).
explanation:
|AC| = |DF| = 13 cm
Using Pythagoras theorem,
|AC|\(^2\) = |AB|\(^2\) + |BC|\(^2\)
13\(^2\) = 12\(^2\) + |BC|\(^2\)
|BC|\(^2\) = 169 - 144 = 25
|BC| = \(\sqrt{25}\)
= 5 cm
Volume of triangular prism = \(\frac{1}{2} \times base \times length \times height\)
= \(\frac{1}{2} \times 5 \times 12 \times 18\)
= 540 cm\(^3\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If \(\sin x = \frac{4}{5}\), find \(\frac{1 + \cot^2 x}{\csc^2 x - 1}\).
Evaluate \(\frac{2\sin 30 + 5\tan 60}{\sin 60}\), leaving your answer in surd form.
explanation:
\(\frac{2\sin 30 + 5\tan 60}{\sin 60}\)
\(\sin 30 = \frac{1}{2}; \tan 60 = \sqrt{3}; \sin 60 = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}\)
\(\therefore \frac{2\sin 30 + 5\tan 60}{\sin 60} = \frac{2(\frac{1}{2}) + 5(\sqrt{3})}{\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}}\)\)
= \(\frac{1 + 5\sqrt{3}}{\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}}\)
= \(\frac{2(1 + 5\sqrt{3})}{\sqrt{3}}\)
= \(\frac{2 + 10\sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{3}}\)
Rationalizing, we get
= \(\frac{2\sqrt{3} + 30}{3}\)
= \(\frac{2}{3} \sqrt{3} + 10\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
